channel.title: Comments on: My TypeScript Workflow Example
channel.description: Manage Your Code Snippets with codeBelt | Code Examples / Tutorials / Articles

item.title: By: Liam
item.dc:creator: Liam
item.description:
You're a diamond in the rough Robert,
I know this is a pretty old article but this is an amazing setup and like others, I've learnt a wealth of Grunt stuff I didn't know previously, thank you so much!
item.content:encoded:
You’re a diamond in the rough Robert,

I know this is a pretty old article but this is an amazing setup and like others, I’ve learnt a wealth of Grunt stuff I didn’t know previously, thank you so much!

item.title: By: robert
item.dc:creator: robert
item.description:
Thanks for the feedback!
I have not done break points with Webstorm but I did see this article: http://www.jetbrains.com/webstorm/webhelp/debugging-typescript.html
You could 'debugger' or use Chrome to put break points https://developer.chrome.com/devtools/docs/javascript-debugging. I think you might be able put break points on your TypeScript sourcemap files. Check out my other article on <a href="https://codebelt.github.io/blog/typescript/typescript-source-maps-example/" title="TypeScript Source Maps Example" rel="nofollow">TypeScript sourcemaps</a>.
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for the feedback!

I have not done break points with Webstorm but I did see this article: http://www.jetbrains.com/webstorm/webhelp/debugging-typescript.html

You could ‘debugger’ or use Chrome to put break points https://developer.chrome.com/devtools/docs/javascript-debugging. I think you might be able put break points on your TypeScript sourcemap files. Check out my other article on TypeScript sourcemaps.

item.title: By: Pavan Kumar
item.dc:creator: Pavan Kumar
item.description:
Hi Robert,
I learnt more than what I was looking for. I came here to learn about compiling typescript via grunt, along with that I got to know about many essential grunt plugin which I never knew existed. Thank you! :)
I saw that you have mentioned your IDE of choice is WebStorm. Am curious to know is there any way to debug application by setting break points in WebStorm, while running 'grunt server' task? (Both in TypeScript and JavaScript file)
item.content:encoded:
Hi Robert,

I learnt more than what I was looking for. I came here to learn about compiling typescript via grunt, along with that I got to know about many essential grunt plugin which I never knew existed. Thank you! :)

I saw that you have mentioned your IDE of choice is WebStorm. Am curious to know is there any way to debug application by setting break points in WebStorm, while running ‘grunt server’ task? (Both in TypeScript and JavaScript file)

item.title: By: robert
item.dc:creator: robert
item.description: Thanks, you could checkout my example files: https://github.com/codeBelt/TypeScript-Boilerplate
item.content:encoded:
Thanks, you could checkout my example files:
https://github.com/codeBelt/TypeScript-Boilerplate

item.title: By: Txus Ordorika
item.dc:creator: Txus Ordorika
item.description: Hey dude many thanks for your example gruntfile. I was having problems with express js and I used as a basis for my work. Many thanks!
item.content:encoded: Hey dude many thanks for your example gruntfile. I was having problems with express js and I used as a basis for my work. Many thanks!
